holidays.name: National Sponge Cake Day
holidays.description: A delicious day dedicated to celebrating the light, airy, and fluffy sponge cake—a classic dessert beloved around the world!
holidays.origin: While exact origins are unclear, this day is an unofficial food holiday created by baking enthusiasts to appreciate the art of sponge cake making.
holidays.funFact: Despite its name, sponge cake doesn’t actually contain any sponge—it’s named for its spongy texture created by whipping eggs and sugar.

holidays.name: International Day for the Remembrance of the Slave Trade and its Abolition
holidays.description: A solemn day to commemorate the tragic history of the transatlantic slave trade and honor those who fought for its abolition.
holidays.origin: Established by UNESCO in 1998, it marks the anniversary of the Haitian Revolution, a key event in the fight against slavery that began on August 23, 1791.
holidays.funFact: Haiti’s uprising was the only slave revolt that led to the founding of an independent nation ruled by former slaves.

holidays.name: National Ride the Wind Day
holidays.description: A quirky day inviting everyone to embrace the freedom and thrill of wind—whether it’s flying a kite, enjoying a breezy bike ride, or simply feeling the breeze in your hair.
holidays.origin: An unofficial holiday encouraging outdoor fun and appreciation of nature's invisible force—wind!
holidays.funFact: The term 'ride the wind' was popularized by windsurfing communities but now refers to any playful interaction with the wind.

holidays.name: World Dog Day in Ukraine
holidays.description: A fun and heartwarming day to celebrate dogs, their companionship, and their roles in Ukrainian culture and history.
holidays.origin: An observance that gained local popularity in Ukraine to honor dogs and raise awareness for animal welfare on August 23.
holidays.funFact: Ukrainian sled dogs were credited with heroic service during harsh winters, helping deliver supplies across snowy terrains.
